poem:
### Errata 

flowers mistaken  
for the hand—  
look closer  
at the petals;  

portraits  
misremembered,  
painted twice  
over by names  
that spiral,  
misaligned  

in inky lines  
of print  
where truth sifts  
like flour  
through fingers  
  
gently,  
yet never  
quite  
  
where it  
lands.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Corrections and clarifications • A photo of the chef Tom Kerridge surrounded by flowers was incorrectly credited to Katherine Anne Rose instead of Alex Lake (‘It’s a constant battle of spinning plates’, 12 May, G2, p6). Meanwhile, a picture caption said that new portraits of King Charles and Queen Camilla were painted by Paul S Benney; that of the king is in fact by Peter Kuhfeld (Royal reveal, 7 May, p5). Both errors were in print only. •". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Corrections and clarifications • A photo of the chef Tom Kerridge surrounded by flowers was incorrectly credited to Katherine Anne Rose instead of Alex Lake (‘It’s a constant battle of spinning plates’, 12 May, G2, p6). Meanwhile, a picture caption said that new portraits of King Charles and Queen Camilla were painted by Paul S Benney; that of the king is in fact by Peter Kuhfeld (Royal reveal, 7 May, p5). Both errors were in print only. •
